snippet: Mr. Fruman roiled literary waters in the 1970s with a biography of Samuel Taylor Coleridge that accused the poet of stealing ideas.
abstract: Norman Fruman, scholar of the poet Coleridge and fierce defender of the Western literary canon, dies at age 88. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: Norman Fruman, a scholar who roiled literary waters in the 1970s with a biography of Samuel Taylor Coleridge that accused the poet of stealing ideas and disingenuously aggrandizing his own creative history, died on April 19 at his home in Laguna Beach, Calif. He was 88. The cause was cancer, said his son, David.

headline.main: Norman Fruman, 88, a Scholar of Coleridge
